issues.description: The problem statement’s UML and text specify that Milkable.messageOnMilk() returns a boolean (true/false), but the solution’s Milkable interface and implementations use String as the return type. This mismatch will confuse students when they implement the interface according to the spec and find the solution uses a different signature.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the return type of messageOnMilk() across all artifacts. Either change the problem statement’s UML and description to specify a String return (and update the boolean text) or modify the solution’s interface and implementations to return a boolean and adjust the implementation messages accordingly.
